lg.l: <«FN1·>Suppos'd to have been made extempore at an Inn upon the Road──</«FN1·>
1Vide──Page. 39. an Imitation of this──────── By Mr Pope
Says my Uncle, I pray now discover What has been the Cause of your Woes,
That you pine & you whine like a Lover?I've seen Molly Mogg at the Rose!
O Nephew! your Grief is but Folly, In Town you may meet better Prog,
Half a Crown there will get you a Molly,A Molly much better yn Mogg.
The School-boy's delight is a Play-Day, The School-Master's Ioy is to flog,
The Milk Maid's delight is on May day,But mine is on sweet Molly Mogg.
Will o' Wisp leads the Trav'ler gadding Thro' Ditch & thro' Quagmire & Bog,
But no Light can e'er set me a madding,But the Eyes of my sweet Molly Mogg.
For Guineas in other Men's Breeches Your Gamesters will palm & will cogg,
But I envy 'em none of their Riches,So I palm my sweet Molly Mogg.
The Heart that's half wounded is ranging, It here & there leaps like a Frog,
But my Heart can never be changing,'Tis so fix'd on my sweet Molly Mogg.
I know that by Wits 'tis recited That Woman, at best, is a Clog;
But I'm not so easily frightedFrom loving my sweet Molly Mogg.
Who follows all Ladies of Pleasure In pleasure is thought but a Hog,
All the Sex cannot give so good measureOf Ioys, as my sweet Molly Mogg.
Those who toast all the Family Royal In Bumpers of Hogan & Nog,
Have Hearts not more true or more loyalThan mine to my sweet Molly Mogg.
A Letter when I am inditing Comes Cupid & gives m a Iog,
Then I fill all my Paper wth writingOf nothing but Sweet Molly Mogg.
If I wou'd not give up the three Graces, I wish I were hang'd like a Dog,
And at Court all the Drawing Room Faces,For a Glance at my Sweet Molly Mogg.
For those Faces want Nature & Spirit, And seem as cut out of a Log,
Iuno, Venus, & Pallas's MeritUnite in my Sweet Molly Mogg.
Were Virgil alive wth his Phyllis,And writing another Eclogue,
Both his Phyllis & fair AmaryllisHe'd give for my sweet Molly Mogg.
When Molly comes up wth the Liquor,Then Iealousy sets me agog,
To be sure she's a Bit for the Vicar,And so I shall lose Molly Mogg.Y29-280L
